amendment.description: Amendment appropriates an additional $4 billion for military personnel quality of life and recruiting programs, defense health, depot maintenance, and high priority support to deployed forces.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 9 printed in House Report 106-549 to appropriate an additional $4 billion during FY 2000 for urgent defense priorities in the areas of personnel benefits, military health care recruitment and retention, and equipment readiness.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Lewis (CA) amendment (A009) Agreed to by recorded vote: 289 - 130 (Roll no. 85).
